collection.description: Gift of the Deering Family. These sketches by Catalan artist Ramón Casas (1866-1932) document the work of an under-represented artist who was influential in modernist art circles in Barcelona and Paris along with his peers John Singer Sargent, Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec, and the young Pablo Picasso. Three bound hardcover volumes of sketches came to the Northwestern University Libraries in 1998 as part of a donation of books that had belonged to NU benefactor Charles Deering (1852-1927). Deering and Casas met in 1904 and established a lifelong friendship. At some point before the donation, a few hundred loose Casas drawings, postcards, and illustrated letters dating from 1891 to 1912 were bound into their current form. There were at least five volumes in the set; two remain in private collections.
collection.title: Ramón Casas Sketchbooks

item.terms_of_use: The images on this web site are from material in the collections of the Charles Deering McCormick Library of Special Collections of Northwestern University Libraries, are provided for use by its students, faculty and staff, and by other researchers visiting this site, for research consultation and scholarly purposes only. Further distribution and/or any commercial use of the images from this site is not permitted.

Top: Ramon Casas and Santiago Rusinol? seated at cafe table with another man. Bottom: Two men outside a concert hall with a woman wearing a veiled hat -- pages 11-13. blank -- page 14. Drawings cut out from letters. Text visible: "muy cerca de Paris," "hiciera mal tiempo." Top: Two women and a man near a window. Bottom: Two men in overcoats carrying luggage in a train station. Sign says "Rouen." -- pages 15-17. blank -- page 18. Drawings cut out from letters. Top: street scene. Middle: interior scene. Bottom: Royal pageant of tiny figures and large king and queen -- pages 19-21. blank -- page 22. Drawings cut out from letters. Top: Groom standing in front of horse and carriage. Bottom: Two standing figures--Erik Satie and Santiago Rusinol? -- pages 23-25. blank -- page 26. Top: Ramon Casas standing on the street in front of a couple and a person with a cart. Bottom: Ramon Casas looking at a canvas on an easel -- pages 27-29. blank -- page 30. Top: Ramon Casas and Santiago Rusinol? carrying canvases down the street. Bottom: Casas writing a letter by lamplight, with overlaid text "Montmartre 8 de Marzo 92." -- pages 31-33. blank -- page 34. Top: Ramon Casas riding a carousel with another man standing in front. Bottom: Ramon Casas and another man standing in front of an outdoor cafe table with bottles and glasses -- page 35-37. blank -- page 38. Drawing cut from letter. Erik Satie in front of the Moulin de la Galette, holding an umbrella, with two men in the background wearing overcoats -- pages 39-41. blank -- page 42. Delivery man in uniform carrying large box -- pages 43-45. blank -- page 46. Seated woman wearing white dress with green bow at neck -- pages 47-49. blank -- page 50. Figure in flamenco costume -- pages 51-53. blank -- page 54. Woman with umbrella walking on bridge with man in background -- pages 55-57. blank -- page 58. Julia Peraire in red and white shawl and black hat (Letter dated "11 octubre 1912" ; fold-out front) -- pages 59-60. Letter, dated 11th of October 1912, from Ramon Casas -- pages 61-62. blank -- page 63. Charles Deering in peasant garb with peasant woman and cow in background -- pages 64-66. blank -- page 67. Untitled -- page 68. verso of page 67 -- pages 69-70. blank -- page 71. Postcard from Tarragona Museo Arqueologico with Deering's face drawn on Venus -- pages 72-74. blank -- page 75. Charles Deering riding a donkey with a shepherd's crook -- pages 76-79. blank -- page 80. Ramon Casas wearing peasant garb carrying a shepherd's crook -- pages 81-83. blank -- page 84. Ramon Casas in dentist's chair with three buckets of blood (Drawing was originally front of folded card, with letter inside) -- page 85. Letter from Ramon Casas from 1912 -- pages 86-87. blank -- page 88. Ramon Casas in dentist's chair with dentist holding pliers -- page 89. verso of page 88 -- pages 90-91. blank -- page 92. Ramon Casas painting Julia Peraire in the studio -- pages 93-95. blank -- page 96. Portrait of six men, signed by portrait subjects, including "M. Blasco." (Inscribed "Molina de Aragon 23 Agosto 1912.") -- page 97. verso of page 96 -- pages 98-130. blank -- page 131. flyleaf -- page 132. inside back cover -- page 133. Back cover

description.item: Correspondence in Spanish, postcards in multiple languages. Holograph, signed.

abstract.item: Consists of mounted, original, signed water colors, pencil sketches, caricatures, correspondence, and postcards; includes several self-portraits, and portraits of Charles Deering. These sketches by Catalan artist Ramón Casas (1866-1932) document the work of an under-represented artist who was influential in modernist art circles in Barcelona and Paris along with his peers John Singer Sargent, Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec, and the young Pablo Picasso. Three bound hardcover volumes of sketches came to the Northwestern University Libraries in 1998 as part of a donation of books that had belonged to NU benefactor Charles Deering (1852-1927). Deering and Casas met in 1904 and established a lifelong friendship.

collection.description: Gift of the Deering Family. These sketches by Catalan artist Ramón Casas (1866-1932) document the work of an under-represented artist who was influential in modernist art circles in Barcelona and Paris along with his peers John Singer Sargent, Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec, and the young Pablo Picasso. Three bound hardcover volumes of sketches came to the Northwestern University Libraries in 1998 as part of a donation of books that had belonged to NU benefactor Charles Deering (1852-1927). Deering and Casas met in 1904 and established a lifelong friendship. At some point before the donation, a few hundred loose Casas drawings, postcards, and illustrated letters dating from 1891 to 1912 were bound into their current form. There were at least five volumes in the set; two remain in private collections.

abstract.item: Consists of mounted, original, signed water colors, pencil sketches, caricatures, correspondence, and postcards; includes several self-portraits, and portraits of Charles Deering. These sketches by Catalan artist Ramón Casas (1866-1932) document the work of an under-represented artist who was influential in modernist art circles in Barcelona and Paris along with his peers John Singer Sargent, Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec, and the young Pablo Picasso. Three bound hardcover volumes of sketches came to the Northwestern University Libraries in 1998 as part of a donation of books that had belonged to NU benefactor Charles Deering (1852-1927). Deering and Casas met in 1904 and established a lifelong friendship.
